aboutTheCompetitionContent1: Cryogenic Electron Tomography (CryoET) is an advanced imaging technique for visualizing cellular structures at near-atomic resolution. CryoET has led to significant scientific advances in our understanding of protein structure, cellular function, and disease. These insights come from analyzing annotated CryoET data where different parts of the cell and even individual proteins are segmented.
aboutTheCompetitionContent2: However, annotating CryoET data by hand is very time-consuming, taking weeks or months for a single dataset. In addition, particle picking, the annotation process of identifying particles of interest within tomograms, is challenging, especially for particles smaller than ribosomes since CryoET data has a low signal-to-noise ratio compared to other imaging modalities. Particle picking is generally done by template matching, which compares a predefined template to potential regions containing the particles of interest in the tomograms. Once particles are picked, they are aligned and averaged to reconstruct structures at near-atomic resolutions, providing insights into cellular mechanisms.
aboutTheCompetitionContent3: Our machine learning competition focuses on enhancing particle picking for a range of particle sizes through the development of machine learning models to generate semantic segmentation masks within 3D CryoET tomograms. The primary aim is to refine the template matching process by identifying areas of interest where template matching should be concentrated. This method narrows down the search space, thereby boosting the accuracy and efficiency of the CryoET computational workflow. Participants are tasked with crafting models that produce masks highlighting the precise locations for template matching, facilitating the identification of specific particles across various tomograms.
adjustFiltersOrCheckPanel: Adjust your filter settings or check the object info panel.
alignmentIdStandardTooltip: <semibold>Portal Standard:</semibold> Standardized alignment used to reconstruct a tomogram ensuring a consistent format and coordinate space across the Portal.
alignmentIdTooltip: <semibold>Alignment ID:</semibold> ID of the alignment used to generate the tilt series for a given tomogram.
annotationsMayRequireTransformation: Annotations may require transformation if the desired tomogram has a different Alignment ID. <url to='https://chanzuckerberg.github.io/cryoet-data-portal/stable/cryoet_data_portal_docsite_data.html#annotations'>Learn about annotation transformation.</url>
author: Author
authorSubmittedTooltip: <semibold>Author Submitted:</semibold> Tomogram contributed by the dataset author.
citePortalText: Learn how to cite this data and the Portal
clickToDownloadViaBrowser: Click to download via your browser
competitionContributorsBlurb: Contributors are listed alphabetically by last name:
competitionDataDetails: Experimental and simulated training data for the CryoET Object Identification Challenge. Each dataset contains tilt series, alignments, tomograms and ground truth annotations for six protein complexes (Apo-ferritin, Beta-amylase, Beta-galactosidase, cytosolic ribosome (80S), thyroglobulin and VLP). Curation procedures are described in detail in the accompanying paper. Details on how the dataset is used in the competition are available on Kaggle.
competitionDataDetailsPast: Experimental and simulated training data for the CryoET Object Identification Challenge. Each dataset contains tilt series, alignments, tomograms and ground truth annotations for six protein complexes (Apo-ferritin, Beta-amylase, Beta-galactosidase, cytosolic ribosome (80S), thyroglobulin and VLP). Curation procedures are described in detail in the accompanying paper. Details on how the dataset was used in the competition are available on Kaggle.
competitionDataSubnote: Want more data for training your model? Find it here on the <url to='/' newTab='true'>CryoET Data Portal</url>.
contentExplanationAlignment: Transformations used to align the tilt series to correct shifts and rotations before tomogram reconstruction.
contentExplanationAnnotation: Labels marking structures in tomograms, generated manually, with machine learning, or a combination.
contentExplanationCtf: Estimated contrast transfer function, describing distortions from the microscope’s optics to correct in the tomogram reconstruction.
contentExplanationDatasetOverview: Summary of the availability and number of entities for each data type across all runs in the dataset.
contentExplanationFrames: Individual 2D images from CryoET data acquisition, used to correct for sample motion and generate tilt series.
contentExplanationRunOverview: List of the availability and number of entities for each data type in this run.
contentExplanationTiltSeries: A sequence of corrected 2D images captured at different angles used to reconstruct a 3D tomogram.
contentExplanationTomograms: 3D reconstructions from tilt series, depicting structures of vitrified samples with nanometer resolution.
contributeAnnotationsCommunity: Contribute annotations to help the community.
contributeCta: We encourage you to share datasets and/or annotations to existing data. Click below to fill out the inquiry form.
copyAndRunAwsCliCommand: Copy and run AWS CLI command in your terminal
copyAndRunCurlCommand: Copy and run cURL command in your terminal
cryoetDataAnnotationMLComp: Competition for Particle Detection in 3D Cryo-Electron Tomography
datasetsDescription: Datasets contain data such as annotations, tomograms, frames, tilt series, and metadata such as CTF and alignment from a single set of experimental conditions
depositionsDescription: Depositions are collections of annotations, or imaging datasets containing annotations created using one or more methods contributed at once.
deprecatedApiBannerText: The Python API v3 will be deprecated on Wednesday, February 26, 2025. $t(deprecatedApiLearnMore)
developAMLModel: Develop a ML model for annotating subcellular structures and proteins in CryoET data
downloadAllRunData: <semibold>Download all run data via our API.</semibold> <url to='$t(apiDocLink)'>Visit API documentation.</url>
downloadAllRunDataViaApiToCreateYourOwnR: Download all Run data via API to create your own reconstructions.
downloadAvailableAnnotationsInSupported: Download available annotations in supported file formats.
downloadTheRunDataToCreateYourOwnAnnotat: Download all Run data via API  to create your own annotations.
downloadWillSaveToCurrentDirectory: Download will save to your current directory. To change save destination, change the current directory in your terminal before continuing.
errorCreatingDatasetTableColumns: Error creating columns for dataset table
exploreDocsCTA: Learn about our data schema, Python API, and tools for data visualization.
fileFormatTooltipMrc: <url to='$t(mrcLink)'>MRC</url>: standard format for CryoET data
fileFormatTooltipNdJson: <url to='$t(ndJsonLink)'>Newline Delimited JSON</url>: format used for point annotations where each point is a JSON on its own line
fileFormatTooltipZarr: <url to='$t(zarrLink)'>OME-Zarr</url>: optimized format for large data
filterByAnyOfTheFollowing: Filter by any of the following
filterByObjectId: Filter by one type of Object ID
filterTooRestrictive: The applied filters may be too restrictive.
groundTruthTooltip: <semibold>Ground Truth:</semibold> Author-curated annotations for use as training or validation data for machine learning models.
haveMoreQuestions: Have a question? Reach out to our team at <url to='mailto:cryoetdataportal@chanzuckerberg.com'>cryoetdataportal@chanzuckerberg.com</url>.
ifYouEncounterIssuesWithDownloadTime: If you  encounter issues with download time, we recommend downloading larger files via API.
impactCTAText: Calling all ML developers! Can you beat the competition winners with your annotations?
impactExplanation: Competition datasets <sdsLink to='/datasets/10445'>10445</sdsLink> and <sdsLink to='/datasets/10446'>10446</sdsLink> contain protein complexes to mimic cellular CryoET data and annotations from months of particle picking.
impactSubTitle: Read the paper on the phantom sample and reference annotations
keyPhotoCaptionDataset: Central slab from a representative tomogram of a {{organismName}} sample.
keyPhotoCaptionDatasetInSilico: Central slab from a representative simulated tomogram with selected set of annotations.
keyPhotoCaptionDatasetInVitro: Central slab from a representative tomogram of the in vitro sample with selected set of annotations.
keyPhotoCaptionDatasetWithAnnotations: Central slab from a representative tomogram of a {{organismName}} sample with selected set of annotations.
keyPhotoCaptionDepositions: Central slab of 4 representative tomograms with selected sets of annotations.
keyPhotoCaptionRunWithAnnotations: Central slab of tomogram {{tomogramId}} with selected set of annotations.
landingHeaderImageAttribution: Top Image: The inner workings of an algal cell as depicted with cryo-electron tomography, which aggregates multiple snapshots of a single piece of material. Visible are the Golgi apparatus (green and magenta), and vesicles (multi-colored circles). | Photo credit: Y. S. Bykkov et al./eLIFE (CC BY 4.0)
landingHeaderTitle: Open access to annotated cryoET tomograms
landingPageCopy1: Currently, annotating tomograms from cryo-electron tomography (cryoET) experiments is a tedious, time-consuming, and often manual process. Our goal is to accelerate this process by catalyzing the development of sophisticated machine-learning methods for automatic annotation, helping researchers find scientific insights faster.
landingPageCopy2: The portal provides biologists and developers open access to high-quality, standardized, annotated data they can readily use to retrain or develop new annotation models and algorithms. We would like to highlight the groups of Julia Mahamid, Jürgen Plitzko, David Agard, John Briggs, Abhay Kotecha, Ben Engel, Danielle Grotjahn, and Grant Jensen for contributing the initial datasets. All contributors to date are listed below.
landingPageCopy3: All tomograms include rich standardized metadata such as data tree structure and naming conventions. Most groups have already provided annotations for their data, and there is a structure to add new annotations to existing tomograms.
landingPageCopy4: We are actively growing the number of annotated datasets on the portal and encourage researchers to <url to='$t(urlDataContributionForm)'>share their data</url>. We are working with <url to='$t(urlEMPIAR)'>EMPIAR</url> to host the data and support annotation.
landingPageCopy5: Ultimately, our vision is to contribute to developing a large, open-access database of annotated and validated 3D structural information for cells that researchers can use to gain new insights into cellular and structural biology.
landingPageWelcomeBlurb: Welcome to the CryoET Data Portal, a project built by the <url to='$t(urlCZII)'>Chan Zuckerberg Imaging Institute</url> and the <url to='$t(urlCZ)'>Chan Zuckerberg Initiative</url>.
methodTypeAutomated: <semibold>Automated:</semibold> Annotations were generated using automated tools or algorithms without supervision.
methodTypeHybrid: <semibold>Hybrid:</semibold> Annotations were generated using a combination of automated and manual methods.
methodTypeInfo: <semibold>Method Type:</semibold> Describes how the annotations were generated.
methodTypeSimulated: <semibold>Simulated:</semibold> Annotations were generated using synthetic or simulated data.
mlCompetitionHasBegun: ML Competition has begun. Enter for cash prizes. $t(mlCompetitionLearnMore)
mlCompetitionIsClosingSoon: ML Competition is closing soon. Enter by 1/29 for cash prizes. $t(mlCompetitionLearnMore)
mlCompetitionRecapCta: Discover how ML advanced annotation of subcellular structures and proteins in cryoET data.
mlCompetitionSurveyBanner: Participants, it's your last chance to <url to='https://chanzuck.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_7NVtWWx911Nuq9w?Q_CHL=updatedbanner'>share feedback</url>! Survey closes on Friday. Every 15th eligible respondent will receive a $100 gift card.

main.title: Exploring CryoET Data in Neuroglancer
main.content: The CryoET Data Portal provides an interactive data viewer powered by Neuroglancer for visualizing and analyzing volumetric cryo-electron tomography (CryoET) data and annotations.Let's run through some key aspects of the data viewer and essential controls.

step1.title: Main viewport
step1.content:
The default visualization is a synchronized four panel layout:

  • Three cross-sectional views showing orthogonal XY, XZ, and YZ slices
  • One 3D view for model visualization and volume rendering

This is configurable from the 'Layout' dropdown in the top bar.

step2.title: Essential controls
step2.content: Move, pan and zoom in each panel with these mouse navigation controls:

step3.title: Keyboard shortcuts
step3.content: Quickly access top tools with shortcuts. Here are some useful shortcuts:
step3.complement: These actions are also easily accessible on the top bar.

step4.title: Layer management
step4.content: Data is organized into distinct layers, which all appear in this menu.You can click the layer's color indicator to toggle its visibility or use the button to the right of the layer to open detailed controls.

step5.title: Layer controls
step5.content: Change the visualization settings of individual layers here. You can change layer colours or opacity, image contrast limits, rendering resolution and more.

step6.title: Controls top panel
step6.content: You can find further controls in the neuroglancer header bar, such as taking screenshots and showing or hiding panels in the viewer, should you need them.

step7.title: Congratulations!
step7.content: You've just learned the basics of navigating annotated tomograms from the CryoET Data Portal with Neuroglancer!We've extracted some of the most crucial functionality of neuroglancer into the portal header, including loading groups of annotations, changing the viewer layout, and more.
step7.recap: As a recap, here are some useful shortcuts
step7.learnMore: Ready to learn more? Visit our <doclink>documentation</doclink>.
step7.access: Easily access this walkthrough again through the help menu.

noResultsBeforeYouTryAgain: Before you try again, here are some tips:
noResultsRemoveFilters: Consider removing or adjusting filters for broader results.
noResultsSearch: Search only looks for words in dataset names.
onlyDisplayingRunsWithAnnotations: Only displaying runs with annotations from <urlNoColor to='{{url}}' variant='dashed-bordered'>Deposition CZCDP-{{id}}: "<ellipsis>{{title}}</ellipsis>"</urlNoColor>
onlyDisplayingRunsFromDeposition: Only displaying runs from Deposition CZCDP-{{id}}: "{{name}}".
onlyDisplayingAnnotationsFromDeposition: Only displaying annotations from Deposition CZCDP-{{id}}: "{{name}}".
onlyDisplayingTomogramsFromDeposition: Only displaying tomograms from Deposition CZCDP-{{id}}: "{{name}}".
onlyDisplayingDatasetsWithOrganismAndDep: Only displaying Datasets containing Organism: "{{organismName}}" and Deposition {{depositionId}}: "{{depositionName}}".
participateInOurCompetitionCTA: Develop a ML model for annotating subcellular structures and proteins in CryoET data.
portalStandardTooltip: <semibold>Portal Standard:</semibold> Tomogram contributed by the Data Portal with standard voxel size.
precisionTooltip: <semibold>Precision:</semibold> Percentage of true positives among the total number of positive predictions. A value of 100% means everything found is actually the object of interest. <url to='https://chanzuckerberg.github.io/cryoet-data-portal/stable/cryoet_data_portal_docsite_data.html#annotations'>Learn More</url>
preferToDownloadViaApi: <semibold>Prefer to download via our API?</semibold> Record the IDs below and visit our <url to='$t(apiDocLink)'>API documentation</url> to learn how.
preferToDownloadViaApiCode: <semibold>Prefer to download via our API?</semibold> Record the code snippet below and visit our <url to='$t(apiDocLink)'>API documentation</url> to learn how.
recallTooltip: <semibold>Recall:</semibold> Percentage of true positives among the actual number of objects. A value of 100% means all objects of interest were found.
resultsMustIncludeAllFileTypes: Results will include all selected Data Types
runDataIncludes: Run data includes all available movie frames, tilt series, tomograms, annotations, and associated metadata.
runsTooltip: <semibold>Run:</semibold> A tomography run is a collection of all data and annotations related to one physical location in a biological specimen. <url to='https://chanzuckerberg.github.io/cryoet-data-portal/stable/cryoet_data_portal_docsite_faq.html?target=data-schema&status=open' target='_blank' rel='noreferrer'>Learn More</url>
runsTooltipDepositionSubtext: Count only shows the number of runs containing deposition data. <urlNoColor to='$t(urlDepositionsDocumentation)' variant='dashed-underlined'>Learn more about depositions in the portal</urlNoColor>.
scoreTooltip: Submissions were scored using an average F <sub className='relative top-sds-xxxs'>β</sub> metric, adjusted for the detection difficulty of each species.
selectASpecificTomogram: Select a specific tomogram from this run to download.
selectTheTomogramToReferenceWith: Select the tomogram to reference with these annotations. For tomograms other than the Portal Standard, annotations may require transformation to be compatible. <url to='https://chanzuckerberg.github.io/cryoet-data-portal/stable/cryoet_data_portal_docsite_data.html#annotations'>Learn More</url>.
surveyBanner: Share first impressions of the portal, or sign up for invites to future feedback activities in <url to='$t(surveyLink)'>this short form</url>.
policyBanner: We are including <url to='/terms'>Terms of Use</url> and a <url to='/dmca'>DMCA Policy</url> on the portal which will take effect September 3, 2025. Please review them to understand your rights.
thankYouToOurDataContributors: Thank You to our Data Contributors…
theseAnnotationsMustBeTransformed: These annotations must be transformed to be compatible with the selected reference tomogram.
thisAnnotationRequiresTransformation: This annotation <semibold>requires</semibold> transformation if used with any of these tomograms:
tiltRangeFilterDescription: Angles are in degrees (°). Tilt range is the difference between the max tilt angle and the min tilt angle.
tiltSeriesTooltip: <semibold>Tilt Series Quality:</semibold> Dataset author's assessment of tilt series quality. Score ranges 1-5, with 5 being best. <url to='https://chanzuckerberg.github.io/cryoet-data-portal/stable/cryoet_data_portal_docsite_data.html#tilt-series-quality'>Learn More</url>
title: CryoET Data Portal
tomogramViewNotImplemented: Tomogram view not implemented in this component
tourBanner: New to Neuroglancer? Learn the essentials in <button type='button' className='text-light-sds-color-primitive-blue-500'>this guided tour</button>.
tutorialsSectionContent: Example notebooks for existing models, such as TomoTwin and DeepFinder, are provided to serve as onboarding materials and baseline solutions. These examples include preliminary results to set performance benchmarks for the competition.
unverifiedObjectsAnnotatedTooltip: Objects not verified by the curators, but annotated.
verifiedObjectsAnnotatedTooltip: Objects identified by the curators or authors that have annotations.
verifiedObjectsNonAnnotatedTooltip: Objects identified by the curators or authors without annotations.
viewDatasetsCta: Find and visualize cryoET datasets in the portal and download to use for your work.
youMustHaveCliInstalled: You must have AWS CLI installed. <url to='$t(awsCliLink)'>How to Install AWS CLI.</url>
youMustHaveCurlInstalled: You must have cURL installed. <url to='$t(curlSetupLink)'>How to Install cURL</url>
